  2. /*                                                                        */
  3. /*                                 OCaml                                  */
  4. /*                                                                        */

  8. /*     en Automatique.                                                    */

  14. /**************************************************************************/

  16. #ifndef CAML_CONFIG_H
  17. ‌#define CAML_CONFIG_H

  19. /* CAML_NAME_SPACE was introduced in OCaml 3.08 to declare compatibility with
  20.    the newly caml_-prefixed names of C runtime functions and to disable the
  21.    definition of compatibility macros for the un-prefixed names. The
  22.    compatibility layer was removed in OCaml 5.0, so CAML_NAME_SPACE is the
  23.    default. */
  24. #ifndef CAML_NAME_SPACE
  25. ‌#define CAML_NAME_SPACE
  26. #endif

  28. #include "m.h"

  30. /* If supported, tell gcc that we can use 32-bit code addresses for
  31. * threaded code, unless we are compiled for a shared library (-fPIC option) */
  32. #ifdef HAS_ARCH_CODE32
  33. #ifndef __PIC__
  34. ‌#  define ARCH_CODE32
  35. #endif /* __PIC__ */
  36. #endif /* HAS_ARCH_CODE32 */

  38. /* No longer used in the codebase, but kept because it was exported */
  39. ‌#define INT64_LITERAL(s) s ## LL

  41. #if defined(_MSC_VER) && !defined(__cplusplus)
  42. ‌#define Caml_inline static __inline
  43. #else
  44. ‌#define Caml_inline static inline
  45. #endif

  47. #include "s.h"

  49. #ifndef CAML_CONFIG_H_NO_TYPEDEFS

  51. #include <stddef.h>

  53. #if defined(HAS_LOCALE_H) || defined(HAS_XLOCALE_H)
  54. ‌#define HAS_LOCALE
  55. #endif

  57. #ifdef HAS_STDINT_H
  58. #include <stdint.h>
  59. #endif

  61. /* Disable the mingw-w64 *printf shims */
  62. #if defined(CAML_INTERNALS) && defined(__MINGW32__)
  63.   /* Headers may have already included <_mingw.h>, so #undef if necessary. */
  64.   #ifdef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
  65. ‌    #undef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
  66.   #endif
  67.   /* <stdio.h> must either be #include'd before this header or
  68.      __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO needs to be 0 when <stdio.h> is processed. The final
  69.      effect will be the same - stdio.h will define snprintf and misc.h will make
  70.      snprintf a macro (referring to caml_snprintf). */
  71. ‌  #define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO 0
  72. #endif

  74. #if defined(__MINGW32__) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1800)
  75. ‌#define ARCH_SIZET_PRINTF_FORMAT "I"
  76. #else
  77. ‌#define ARCH_SIZET_PRINTF_FORMAT "z"
  78. #endif

  80. /* Types for 32-bit integers, 64-bit integers, and
  81.    native integers (as wide as a pointer type) */

  83. #ifndef ARCH_INT32_TYPE
  84. #if SIZEOF_INT == 4
  85. ‌#define ARCH_INT32_TYPE int
  86. ‌#define ARCH_UINT32_TYPE unsigned int
  87. ‌#define ARCH_INT32_PRINTF_FORMAT ""
  88. #elif SIZEOF_LONG == 4
  89. ‌#define ARCH_INT32_TYPE long
  90. ‌#define ARCH_UINT32_TYPE unsigned long
  91. ‌#define ARCH_INT32_PRINTF_FORMAT "l"
  92. #elif SIZEOF_SHORT == 4
  93. ‌#define ARCH_INT32_TYPE short
  94. ‌#define ARCH_UINT32_TYPE unsigned short
  95. ‌#define ARCH_INT32_PRINTF_FORMAT ""
  96. #else
  97. #error "No 32-bit integer type available"
  98. #endif
  99. #endif

  101. #if defined(__MINGW32__) && !__USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
  102. ‌  #define ARCH_INT64_TYPE long long
  103. ‌  #define ARCH_UINT64_TYPE unsigned long long
  104. ‌  #define ARCH_INT64_PRINTF_FORMAT "I64"
  105. #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
  106. ‌  #define ARCH_INT64_TYPE __int64
  107. ‌  #define ARCH_UINT64_TYPE unsigned __int64
  108. ‌  #define ARCH_INT64_PRINTF_FORMAT "I64"
  109. #else
  110.   #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
  111. ‌    #define ARCH_INT64_TYPE long
  112. ‌    #define ARCH_UINT64_TYPE unsigned long
  113. ‌    #define ARCH_INT64_PRINTF_FORMAT "l"
  114.   #elif SIZEOF_LONGLONG == 8
  115. ‌    #define ARCH_INT64_TYPE long long
  116. ‌    #define ARCH_UINT64_TYPE unsigned long long
  117. ‌    #define ARCH_INT64_PRINTF_FORMAT "ll"
  118.   #else
  119.     #error "No 64-bit integer type available"
  120.   #endif
  121. #endif

  123. #ifndef HAS_STDINT_H
  124. /* Not a C99 compiler, typically MSVC.  Define the C99 types we use. */
  125. ‌typedef ARCH_INT32_TYPE int32_t;
  126. ‌typedef ARCH_UINT32_TYPE uint32_t;
  127. ‌typedef ARCH_INT64_TYPE int64_t;
  128. ‌typedef ARCH_UINT64_TYPE uint64_t;
  129. #if SIZEOF_SHORT == 2
  130. ‌typedef short int16_t;
  131. ‌typedef unsigned short uint16_t;
  132. #else
  133. #error "No 16-bit integer type available"
  134. #endif
  135. ‌typedef unsigned char uint8_t;
  136. #endif

  138. #if SIZEOF_PTR == SIZEOF_LONG
  139. /* Standard models: ILP32 or I32LP64 */
  140. ‌typedef long intnat;
  141. ‌typedef unsigned long uintnat;
  142. ‌#define ARCH_INTNAT_PRINTF_FORMAT "l"
  143. #elif SIZEOF_PTR == SIZEOF_INT
  144. /* Hypothetical IP32L64 model */
  145. ‌typedef int intnat;
  146. ‌typedef unsigned int uintnat;
  147. ‌#define ARCH_INTNAT_PRINTF_FORMAT ""
  148. #elif SIZEOF_PTR == 8
  149. /* Win64 model: IL32P64 */
  150. ‌typedef int64_t intnat;
  151. ‌typedef uint64_t uintnat;
  152. ‌#define ARCH_INTNAT_PRINTF_FORMAT ARCH_INT64_PRINTF_FORMAT
  153. #else
  154. #error "No integer type available to represent pointers"
  155. #endif

  157. ‌#define UINTNAT_MAX ((uintnat)-1)

  159. #endif /* CAML_CONFIG_H_NO_TYPEDEFS */

  161. /* Endianness of floats */

  163. /* ARCH_FLOAT_ENDIANNESS encodes the byte order of doubles as follows:
  164.    the value [0xabcdefgh] means that the least significant byte of the
  165.    float is at byte offset [a], the next lsb at [b], ..., and the
  166.    most significant byte at [h]. */

  168. #if defined(__arm__) && !defined(__ARM_EABI__)
  169. ‌#define ARCH_FLOAT_ENDIANNESS 0x45670123
  170. #elif defined(ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN)
  171. ‌#define ARCH_FLOAT_ENDIANNESS 0x76543210
  172. #else
  173. ‌#define ARCH_FLOAT_ENDIANNESS 0x01234567
  174. #endif


  177. /* We use threaded code interpretation if the compiler provides labels
  178.    as first-class values (GCC 2.x). */

  180. #if defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ >= 2 && !defined(DEBUG) \
  181.     && !defined (SHRINKED_GNUC)
  182. ‌#define THREADED_CODE
  183. #endif


  186. /* Memory model parameters */

  188. /* The size of a page for memory management (in bytes) is [1 << Page_log].
  189.    [Page_size] must be a multiple of [sizeof (value)].
  190.    [Page_log] must be be >= 8 and <= 20.
  191.    Do not change the definition of [Page_size]. */
  192. ‌#define Page_log 12             /* A page is 4 kilobytes. */
  193. ‌#define Page_size (1 << Page_log)

  195. /* Initial size of stack (bytes). */
  196. #ifdef DEBUG
  197. ‌#define Stack_init_bsize (64 * sizeof(value))
  198. #else
  199. ‌#define Stack_init_bsize (4096 * sizeof(value))
  200. #endif

  202. /* Minimum free size of stack (bytes); below that, it is reallocated. */
  203. ‌#define Stack_threshold_words 32
  204. ‌#define Stack_threshold (Stack_threshold_words * sizeof(value))

  206. /* Number of words used in the control structure at the start of a stack
  207.    (see fiber.h) */
  208. #ifdef ARCH_SIXTYFOUR
  209. ‌#define Stack_ctx_words (6 + 1)
  210. #else
  211. ‌#define Stack_ctx_words (6 + 2)
  212. #endif

  214. /* Default maximum size of the stack (words). */
  215. /* (1 Gib for 64-bit platforms, 512 Mib for 32-bit platforms) */
  216. ‌#define Max_stack_def (128 * 1024 * 1024)


  219. /* Maximum size of a block allocated in the young generation (words). */
  220. /* Must be > 4 */
  221. ‌#define Max_young_wosize 256
  222. ‌#define Max_young_whsize (Whsize_wosize (Max_young_wosize))


  225. /* Minimum size of the minor zone (words).
  226.    This must be at least [Max_young_wosize + 1]. */
  227. ‌#define Minor_heap_min (Max_young_wosize + 1)

  229. /* Default size of the minor zone. (words)  */
  230. ‌#define Minor_heap_def 262144

  232. /* Minimum size increment when growing the heap (words).
  233.    Must be a multiple of [Page_size / sizeof (value)]. */
  234. ‌#define Heap_chunk_min (15 * Page_size)


  237. /* Default speed setting for the major GC.  The heap will grow until
  238.    the dead objects and the free list represent this percentage of the
  239.    total size of live objects. */
  240. ‌#define Percent_free_def 120

  242. /* Default setting for the major GC slice smoothing window: 1
  243.    (i.e. no smoothing)
  244. */
  245. ‌#define Major_window_def 1

  247. /* Maximum size of the major GC slice smoothing window. */
  248. ‌#define Max_major_window 50

  250. /* Default setting for the ratio of custom garbage to major heap size.
  251.    Documented in gc.mli */
  252. ‌#define Custom_major_ratio_def 44

  254. /* Default setting for the ratio of custom garbage to minor heap size.
  255.    Documented in gc.mli */
  256. ‌#define Custom_minor_ratio_def 100

  258. /* Default setting for maximum size of custom objects counted as garbage
  259.    in the minor heap.
  260.    Documented in gc.mli */
  261. ‌#define Custom_minor_max_bsz_def 8192

  263. /* Minimum amount of work to do in a major GC slice. */
  264. ‌#define Major_slice_work_min 512

  266. /* Default allocation policy. */
  267. ‌#define Allocation_policy_def caml_policy_best_fit

  269. /* Default size of runtime_events ringbuffers, in words, in powers of two */
  270. ‌#define Default_runtime_events_log_wsize 16

  272. #endif /* CAML_CONFIG_H */
